website_summaries.verdict: A simple and uniquely designed, visually stimulating mobile.
pros: Features a variety of strikingly designed cards with high-contrast patterns
Designs range from simple to more complex for age-appropriate stimulation and visual development
Cards are marked by age for easy selection
Easy to set up and use
cons: A basic mobile with no sound or movement features

customer_reviews.title: Wish it were compatible with music box
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who want to attach a third party music box, it's not made for that, but with some ingenuity you can jury rig it. See my photos for my set up. *edit* got it to attach to the pack n play! See picture. Also, my 2 month old loves it. Although he seems to love his other mobile too. He just likes mobiles.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My baby LOOOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is hard to keep entertained but whenever we put him on the crib, he is happy because he can look at this great mobile. The only suggestion I would make is to have it move on its own, but again, I wouldn't want anything bulky. The design on this one is pretty perfect, you just need to stay near by to keep it moving.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina M. Hilario

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for newborn. She's now 3 months and still loves looking at this. It doesn't spin but I leave a fan running in the bedroom and it spins it for her. She also has fancy mobile that spins, plays music and lights up. She hates it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The problem is that the pieces are easy to fall off
customer_reviews.text: This pictures really catch my baby boy's eye. While he is looking at them, I could do something else! The problem is that the pieces are easy to fall off. That's annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a crib-avoiding little one
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to keep my son entertained in his crib, as he hated going down. Nothing has worked incredibly well, but this seemed to capture his attention for a few months, before he started standing (and pulling off the disks). I like that you can change the disks, and that the mobile itself is not one of the more obnoxious (in my opinion) brightly colored ones. The disks sometimes fell off on their own, but likely because they weren't firmly snapped in place. It did the trick for us.
customer_reviews.author: Evie FoxTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit well on wider crib frame
customer_reviews.text: Love that it has slim design and image disc cards are interchangeable based on baby’s age (0-2 months, 2 months, 3 months). Has extra cards which is nice in case a card gets lost and can store spare cards on vertical hooks on mobile. Downside is the section that attaches to crib is grooved and does not attached securely everywhere on crib frame for this reason. Does not fit on wider areas of crib frame. Made it work and it is attached off-center. Still like product just wish it was more versatile across all parts of crib frame.
customer_reviews.author: LRS

customer_reviews.title: Bright and engaging
customer_reviews.text: I debated quite a while before ordering this mobile because I wanted one I could temporarily attach to a pack n play. Fortunately it is workable (see pics) until I move it to the crib. No need to cut a hole, as it will attach thru the corner slots and can be leaned if necessary to view while baby plays. Also I’ve had no issue with the cards falling because they are not within baby’s reach.
customer_reviews.author: sscvillemom

customer_reviews.title: Makes Baby Hypno-Toad
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty amazing. I rigged it up with a battery-powered device that turns the mobile and has music, as was suggested by another reviewer. My baby is just over two months old now and we have had this for probably three weeks. He loves it. He will stare at it easily for twenty minutes. Usage tips: the images come with age guidelines written on them in small print. I found that really helpful. The images tend to excite my baby, so I would not get this if you’re looking for something for bedtime. It does calm my baby a bit if he’s crying, but it definitely does not make him sleepy.
customer_reviews.author: Whtbat

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this mobile. Especially the changeable pattern pictures. My only problem was that the adjustable mounting bracket was too small to fit on the crib or the pack n play. I had to modify it to make it work. We ended up cutting off the adjustable part and screw it to the crib. Otherwise I'd give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jessalyn Newton

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I wanted a developmental low sensory mobile for our son and this was perfect. It has labeled based on what babies can see month by month what you should put out at one time, and even though our baby is 6 months now he still loves the picture of the baby that is for 2 months and talks to it all the time. They also have a travel mobile that can be clipped onto car seats Etc. That allows our son to fall asleep on his own in the car and in the pack and play because they are the same pictures that he falls asleep to in his crib at home.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Dieselberg

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves this mobile! He follows it with his eyes and it makes him smile. My only complaint is I wish it rotated automatically.
customer_reviews.author: ccbdav

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for first couple months!
customer_reviews.text: This is a streamline and simple mobile that fascinated my newborn for 3 months. Bigger musical mobiles overstimulated her, but this one had perfect shapes and colors to keep her cooing without reaching a sensory limit. The shapes can be changed with her eye development which was fun to watch. Give it a little tap and it will spin, and wow is that fun!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline S

customer_reviews.title: Our baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is now 4 months old. We've had this product for a couple months now. He has really been enjoying it! Be aware that it doesn't spin on its own but that doesn't bother our baby so I don't see that as a downfall. You can change the pictures and it offers different picture recommendations for different ages. It was quick and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: VSchmidt713

customer_reviews.title: she seems to particularly like looking at the image of a face
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter started to notice the pictures at about 6 weeks of age. Now, at 8 weeks, she seems to particularly like looking at the image of a face. I like that this doesn't turn automatically -- it gives her time to focus on the individual images. Other nice features: it can be raised and lowered, so that it will remain out of reach as she grows; also, it comes with additional picture discs that will keep her interested as she develops.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality, impossible to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. Impossible to assemble arches without filing down part of the arm as described and shown in other reviews/photos. This mobile is way too expensive for me to have to fix/modify in order to use. The pieces that hold the image cards in place also didn’t feel secure. I could see the whole thing being knocked apart if bumped into when putting baby into or removing from crib. The whole thing seems very fragile/flimsy. It’s a shame because these images are good for baby development, but overall a poorly constructed product.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Love this mobile!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this mobile since our baby was born (she's about 6 months now). Love the variety in the pictures, and the ability to change them out! Always seems to keep our little one fascinated. Only downside is the pieces can be a little fickle, and fall off easily if you hit them. Need to be careful when laying a baby down not to disturb the mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Mal

customer_reviews.title: This saved us!
customer_reviews.text: My son was treated with a bone marrow transplant and we were in the hospital for months. This mobile was easy to put together, and instantly caught his attention. The quality is great and it looks very modern. The nurses all asked me where I got it and were very impressed with the mobile. I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: M.W.

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!!! You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like there is no need for any other Mobils on the market! My baby started using it at one month old. Now three months old, I can put her in there fully awake and she will watch it for 30 to 45 minutes before falling asleep. Changing the images is so easy! My baby gets all giggly when I show her a card and flip it over to the new level. Other than being a little tough to attach to the bassinet, everything is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew&Holly Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mobile designed to appeal to the child, not the parent!
customer_reviews.text: My infant daughter loves this thing. I did a lot of research when buying a mobile, and ended up with this. While it's not the prettiest mobile, it is actually designed to appeal to the child, not the parent. I love that there are age-specific sides - I recently changed from the 0-2month sides to 3 month, and she was so engaged in the new sides, it was incredible. Pair this with a mobile motor with music and you have a very engaging item for your infant!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun T

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, not just for cribs
customer_reviews.text: My baby isn't sleeping in his crib yet but I was able to swap out the little stuffed stars on his swing mobile with the hanging pieces from this mobile. Even if we never use it in his crib this was 100% worth the purchase price as he is only 4 weeks and already enjoys looking at these pieces when he never seemed to notice the boring little attachments that came with the swing.
customer_reviews.author: Liana Regan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We were transitioning our 3 month old to his crib and wanted a mobile to make the crib a happy place for him. I read the reviews and along with the affordable price, I decided to take the plunge. Our little guy really loves looking at the disks! The only negatives I could say is that, as some other reviewers said, the disks do occasionally come unhooked or askew but not enough to annoy me. The other thing that would be a nice feature would be a light on it so he could see it at night. Otherwise I'd say it's definitely worth the purchase, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey C

customer_reviews.title: Baby not really interested
customer_reviews.text: We had these from baby’s 1 month - 6 months and the twins didn’t really look at them. The discs did fall out a few times (we had 2 of these mobiles and the quality of the “hooks” that hold the discs were different on them). It was easy to install. The images were appropriate according to my child development textbooks from college. Overall, I thought having a mobile in the crib was a hassle - getting baby in and out and bumping it, changing sheets (I ended up taking it down and reinstalling every time), and having a video monitor also made a mobile an added challenge because it got in the way of viewing my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: The sooner the better!
customer_reviews.text: My only regret is that I waited until my son was 2 1/2 months to buy. We co-sleep so I couldn't figure out where to put it but we did and my son loves it! He's now 5 1/2 months and entirely too active for a mobile so we use the discs to exercise his neck, help him reach his feet and practice holding his attention. Am thinking of working them into decorations since he loves them so much! Great buy for babies!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Best mobile you could possibly buy
customer_reviews.text: I can't rave about this enough. My child ALWAYS needs to be entertained and when we got this was the first time I could do something for more than five minutes without her screaming for attention. She was absolutely enthralled. Now that she's nearing five months, it's not as effective but I recommend to every expecting parent. Just the discs alone have gone with us everywhere. Back of the seat for car rides, randomly stuck on the swing, anywhere. The only thing is I wish it was motorized. We ended up getting a motor and jerry-rigging it so it moved, but it's been a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Dinolov

customer_reviews.title: Best Infant Mobile Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is about the best mobile there is for a new baby!! The cards are facing flat so the baby can view them so easily. The cards are also all black, white, or red and made up of wonderful designs to help the baby develop his vision. My little 4 week old grandson began kicking and cooing as soon as he was presented with this mobile. I recommend it for all newborn babies!!
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: Baby likes it, wish it spun.
customer_reviews.text: My baby likes this mobile and all of the cards it comes with. He didn't really start caring about it until he was 2 months old. At 4 months he will gaze at it happily long enough for my to take a shower - which is a lifesaver. My only complaint is that I wish it had the option to spin, baby loses interest after a while because it doesn't move.
customer_reviews.author: inaccessiblerail

customer_reviews.title: Works on our alma mini crib!
customer_reviews.text: I had this mobile for my son and he loved staring at it. It's such a great concept. Not as cute as furry animals, but so much better for their development (which is what matters!) Had to write a review, because we are expecting again and using a mini-crib this time. I was worried the slats would be too small to fit, but the mobile works great on our Bloom Alma Mini Crib. Don't hesitate to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Wright

customer_reviews.title: Just okay. Does not move or wind up!
customer_reviews.text: The circles come undone at times but it does attract my baby’s eyes from time to time and she does enjoy looking at it. Con 1: it doesn’t move on it’s on. No wind up anything so you have to manually spin it but then it just stops after seconds. Con 2: the circles on the mobile don’t stay attached the way they should, I would find them pulling out of the holes and popping loose. Overall not bad but nothing to phone home about.
customer_reviews.author: InTheKnow

customer_reviews.title: I received someone else’s returned item. Yuck
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Great toy for visual stimulation. I gave 3 stars because the box I received was someone else’s return. I had to disinfect all the parts as it grossed me out to have a returned item in my baby’s crib. Bags were all torn open or missing and all was loose in the box. I would’ve paid a few dollars more for a new item if I would’ve known I was receiving someone’s seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Laura J

customer_reviews.title: A must for up to 5 months old babies!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mobile for young babies. This kept my baby engaged from 4 weeks old to 5 months. Really helped with eye coordination and tracking. I think this is a much better mobile option over fluffy toys. This stimulates their brains and encourages eye coordination. This is the only mobile that also helps wit development. Now that baby is older and doesn't pay attention to the mobile, I recycled the pictures and hung them around her play pen. She loves to look at them and hold them. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Epollak

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, Cheap, and Not Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, but the execution is extremely cheaply made & overpriced. I’m super bummed that I can’t return this & really regret this purchase. I love the patterns, but it just looks so cheap and flimsy, that I can’t justify the price of $30+.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Hz

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this mobile!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 month old loves this! I purchased this after reading about memory games that you can play with your infant with mobiles (change out one item once a week and it triggers their use of memory function). This mobile works well for that game and it holds my infants attention for 15 minutes at a time some days. The mobile has interchangeable discs that are progressively more complex and colorful for infants developmental stages from 0-3+ months. Knowing how much my baby likes this- I would have paid three times as much for it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit our crib sides.
customer_reviews.text: I like the designs on cards. I don't even mind that there is no music and does not spin on it's own. The problem I had with it was that it didn't fit on the side of our crib. Even if it did fit, the design of the crib has a downward sloping curve from the back to the front on both sides so it just wouldn't work. So I can either keep the cards for the baby to play with later or I can return it. SMH.
customer_reviews.author: HNR

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant! I have no idea why people but other, boring, more expensive mobiles?
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why anyone buys any other mobile out there? All this would need is some soft music and it truly would be perfect! My daughter loves this so much more than her boring pink and grey bunny mobile it's ridiculous! And I feel like she actually is learning something as she lays in her crib. It's very easy to put together and you can change the positions of all of the disks so your baby continues to learn as they get older. Brilliant design for hopefully our future brilliant children!
customer_reviews.author: Alia The Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Baby is obsessed with this mobile
customer_reviews.text: Love this mobile! Easy to put together and to clean. I like that the pictures face downward, so the baby can actually see it properly. I also like there's a variety of images with the appropriate age on each disc, so you can mix it up when baby gets bored of an image. My baby is absolutely obsessed with this mobile, and she spends several minutes every morning just chatting away at it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for my baby
customer_reviews.text: My baby is in love with this. Pictures they see from the crib are interchangeable depending on the baby's age (I've changed them twice and baby has loved them all) so they don't get bored. Also the height of the mobile is adjustable, when baby was very little I had to get it super close to his face, that way he could see the pictures perfectly since his first month...My little one says 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it but doesn’t spin
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves the mobile and “talks” with the picture of the baby! So adorable. It doesn’t rotate so I bought a separate battery operated spinner. All together I spent $50. Not sure it’s worth that much and probably could have done without the spinner. But baby does love the mobile and seems to get a lot of stimulation from it.
customer_reviews.author: Erica A

customer_reviews.title: Wont thread without breaking and update
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine after a long wait !! The two main arches don't thread .i will break it if I try as there is no way D arch will go fully through C without breaking the small holders meant to keep it in place . Very disappointed. Update : It eventually did thread but it’s just a very bad quality product. The pictures keep falling off be mobile onto the baby. Is there no quality control of this product??
customer_reviews.author: Tee Jay

customer_reviews.title: Made for babies point of view.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that could make this better is if it would turn. Baby loves to look at the designs. I love that you can change them as they grow. One of the only mobiles that focus on babies view point. Others are cute, but not for baby’s point of view.
customer_reviews.author: Barrie Adkins

customer_reviews.title: My son likes it
customer_reviews.text: I change the cards out. My son follows them around as they turn. I bought a music thing that also turns and my husband attached them together so now it plays music and turns for my son. I’m satisfied that my son is not looking at the bottom of teddy bears or whatever instead he has something interesting to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it, pictures fall off easily though if you bump taking the baby in or out of the crib
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves it and you can easily height adjust which is very nice. The only negative is the pictures fall off easily though if you bump taking the baby in or out of the crib
customer_reviews.author: DJAP

customer_reviews.title: Baby is obsessed with this mobile
customer_reviews.text: My baby LOVES this mobile. She started being able to focus on it at about four weeks old, and by six weeks she was obsessed! If I need to get things done I can put her in the crib with the mobile and she'll stare at the pictures and talk to them for ages. Sometimes I'm hesitant to take her out since she seems like she's having the time of her life in there and engages with the mobile more than any other toy. I like that the pictures are interchangeable so we can keep her interested.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great mobile, especially since it has developmental input and growth for changing pictures. Only gave it 4 stars bc it wasn't the easiest directions but not impossible to put together. Also really hard to attach to pack n play - but we found way to attach nearby that works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Anna A

customer_reviews.title: I love how it's lightweight
customer_reviews.text: While my 3 week old isn't very interested in it yet, this is a decent product. I love how it's lightweight, and easy to install. I was tentative while putting it together, as it seemed as though I was going to snap the mobile arms, and I'm hoping it stays intact when I disassemble it to move. I like that there are two extra images, in case one breaks, or just to rotate out for interest. Will be recommending this to family and friends, especially since the images are tailored to different stages of infant eye development.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good product for basic cribs
customer_reviews.text: Simple assembly. May not work with higher end cribs that have a thicker decorative top rail. This is designed to mount to cribs like the one pictured in the manufacturer's photo. I used a 3M command strip to mount the upper hook to the backside of the upper rail and it fits fine. My daughter (4 weeks old) instantly locked onto it and actually smiled the most consistently she has so far while looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ferree

customer_reviews.title: Whole family loves them
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has loved these as long as she has been able to see. She's in her 3rd month now and every time we lay her down under these she gets the BIGGEST smile. Would definitely recommend. The height adjustment alone is great. The fact that it's a mobile with something that she can both see (instead of the bottom of a stuffed animal hanging for adults to see -_- ) and helps development is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Best Mobile!
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot about development for babies and this mobile fit the bill perfectly. The install was super easy, it’s a little flimsy but it doesn’t matter because I only touch it softly to make it move. My baby loves to look at it, the images are marked for each age and it’s so easy to mix them around. I love that this helps with the development of his cognitive thinking.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Do not turn by itself
customer_reviews.text: I have to use a fan near it to help it turn. My baby feels bored if it doesn’t turn. I think it will be better if it turns, even powered by battery.
customer_reviews.author: Lilizzzz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stimulation for very young babies
customer_reviews.text: 8 week old baby mesmerized by this mobile. It is very easy to assemble. It includes disks that can be changed to hold baby’s interest and expand concentration. Also, the price is right. This is a good investment in your child’s development.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old loves this mobile. When we out it up at first we were disappointed...until we saw her face. She could not take her eyes off of the objects. She was entertained for a good 1/2 hour just looking up and kicking.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: But the problem is that the pieces fall down easily. Its only for big cribs
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl loves it! But the problem is that the pieces fall down easily. Its only for big cribs. Not for coosleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Patronazo!

customer_reviews.title: It should rotate, otherwise useless.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, useless item.It is good that we have another crib mobile , which rotates and has music, and lights.So my husband just attached this toys on that rotating mobile temporary.Otherwise very boring.Going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Iuliia I.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble AND visually stimulating for my baby
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to put together. My baby is 8 weeks old and as soon as I put him in the crib he was interested in it. I love how it's a mobile that actually is for HIM and not just for the decor of the nursery. I also appreciate that the images can be changed as often as I'd like - this will keep it interesting for him- maybe help him enjoy his "me time" in the crib a bit more :) And it's so easy to swap the tiles that I will actually do it for him. :) I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So stimulating for baby!
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this mobile. I got it when he was a month old and started having increased happily awake time. He loved it instantly! He is now 2 months, and I’ve switched out the cards to the 2+ months option. I love that I can change out the cards as he gets older! The images stimulate his brain, his arms and legs are moving as he is so excited in his crib. The images are so stimulating for him, he will lay there for 15 to 20 minutes happily cooing, kicking, and giggling! Seeing as how this is one of his favorite spots in our house, I highly recommend this mobile for babies 0 to 3+ months!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Baby's Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson loves to stare at the age-appropriate pictures and designs on his mobile. The pictures are changeable according to the developmental readiness of the baby. Great gift for any baby!
customer_reviews.author: M. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great for development of baby. Awesome watching newborn show interest at an early age.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mobile. This mobile was recommended to me in my new mothers group. I am so happy that I purchased. I purchased when my baby was 1 month. I have enjoyed changing out the cards each month. It is great watching my son watch the cards. I found he really loved looking at the picture of the baby face so I left that one up longer than the 2 months. It is great because it is the only mobile I found that is purely for the child's benefit and not just to make he nursery look "cute".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great mobile. Baby loves it. I added a music box which was not necessarily easy to do but with a little out of thw box thinking it was not a huge deal. My lo loves looking at it even at 2mo old.
customer_reviews.author: Onamission

customer_reviews.title: keep your baby engaged with this!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this for our baby by looks of it and thought its overpriced at $25 just for few powces of hanging papers. It proved me wrong. Our baby loves it and interacts with it. Often times i have found my baby awake in the crib and playing with this toy/laughing/kind of talking to it. Do give it a try and change pictures as your baby grows.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: They are not so expensive like other mobiles and definitely helpful for the baby's eye ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mobile at the same with Manhattan Toy Wimmer-Ferguson Infant Stim Mobile. They are not so expensive like other mobiles and definitely helpful for the baby's eye coordination. I purchased this for my son who had a laser surgery and seeing him fascinated by these images tell me that I made the right purchase for him. He loves the baby face.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and decided to give this a try. It’s a nightmare. Very flimsy, toys fall off on their heads, it doesn’t even move by itself you have to turn it by hand. Falls apart so quickly. I trashed it after 3 nights. Completely wasted my money on this mobile
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Our LO loves this mobile! He used to never lay in the pack n play for more than 10 min and then I got him this and he’ll now look at it for half an hour!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son’ fav
customer_reviews.text: My son is so obsessed with them everyday from one month old and now he is going to be three month old. He becomes so excited when he sees them and moves like dancing! It’s the best thing I have ever bought for him. And I like the idea which you replace the cards when baby grows old.
customer_reviews.author: jolie

customer_reviews.title: Babies love it.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently this is good for kids developing brains. I’ve given this as a gift to 3 newborns and they all loved it!
customer_reviews.author: RJ20

customer_reviews.title: Has been so great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mobile because it has been the only one I found that the babies can actually see (the object/picture) while laying down. I use it in the crib but my friend uses her's at the changing table to keep her baby entertained.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: its pretty good, i like that you change the pictures as baby grows. not so heasy to adjust the height. Also it wouldnt attach to our pack-n-play. i had to clamp it to a cinder block behind the pack n play.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Great Mobile
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for my niece. We love it and the baby really loved looking at it. The attachments fall off too easily for my taste, but since she is a baby, she can't touch them. Overall it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tnesmith

customer_reviews.title: Great mobile, but it comes apart easily!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the idea and concept for this mobile, but the images fall off of the hooks extremely easily. It does not spin automatically, so when I would spin it with my hand, I would need to make sure none of the pieces fell off before I left the room for my daughter to fall asleep. She was so engaged with this mobile, though! i would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: I had one for my daughter and she loved it so much I took the plastic discs off ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second mobile of this type. I had one for my daughter and she loved it so much I took the plastic discs off and used them as she got older. My son (7 weeks) is equally intrigued by the black and white colors. Easy to attach to the crib and I like that it has a slider to move it up as baby grows and gets control of his limbs.
customer_reviews.author: fitzy77

customer_reviews.title: Received a used one instead of new
customer_reviews.text: The mobile seems like one that's suitable for young babies and I like the high contrast pictures and no music. However, the item I received (sold by Amazon) looked like an open-box item. The picture discs have obvious signs of wear and scratches on them. Disappointed with the product I received and now I have to go through the hassle of returning it. Also, the clasp to secure it to the crib didn't work with ours.
customer_reviews.author: Iviee Li

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit our crib
customer_reviews.text: The mobile did not fit my crib. Missed the return window. So this was a pretty useless baby item purchase for us. Our crib has a thicker frame. Item said fits most cribs just not ours.
customer_reviews.author: Marylee R.

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t revolve on its own at all so you have to sit there spinning it for your baby, and that’s when the whole thing falls apart. I didn’t find this stimulating for my baby and it was frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dassie Waldman

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts as baby’s focus and age changes.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for babies as they learn to focus. My grandson has loved his from 6 weeks. He is now 3 months. As the child grows older you can adjust the mobile to appropriate colors and shapes for age. Just wish it came with music. I ordered musical box in addition. Used recommendation from other purchasers.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Love it, will buy as gift for others
customer_reviews.text: It keeps the baby entertained on the changing table. I like that the pictures can be changed out easily. I kind of wish they attached differently, they feel like they could fall easily, but I haven't had that happen, and if it did it's just a plastic disk so not really dangerous. It comes with around 10 double sided disks you can change out, and it's neat to see which ones interest your baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amy N

customer_reviews.title: Good Product that catches the attention of a newborn.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is now a month old. She really stays focused on this when it is turning above her.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ackley

customer_reviews.title: Stimulating, classic mobile
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mobile with age-appropriate images. Used a different mobile arm and added a music box so that the four hanging pieces would rotate and the baby could enjoy music. She is so very happy with this set-up. I highly recommend this music box: SHILOH Baby Crib Musical Mobile Battery-Operated 60 Songs White.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: a little earlier for newborns
customer_reviews.text: Since the little is always sleepy all the day, this is a little earlier for newborns, I would recommend to buy later, probably 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: wen xiong

customer_reviews.title: ... makes me sad..
customer_reviews.text: Honestly.. I thought it would be great because it seemed educational.. but my baby barely looks at it. If he does he tries to touch it and can’t because it’ll fall off and hit his face if we let him. Also, he cries when he sees the designs. I think the classic dolls would be much better. I regret making this purchase...
customer_reviews.author: MamaTokie

customer_reviews.title: Mehh
customer_reviews.text: Paint comes off and pieces fall off easily. My baby was not interested in it either!! Very cheap look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Adey Abeba

customer_reviews.title: Good toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter really likes this on her play gym, she grabs at the ring. The Velcro is really really weak, though, so the ring is torn off the tiger really easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy it.
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves it. We put it on our pack n play, and he will spend a good 20 - 30 minutes laying looking it at it, smiling and being quite vocal. He is 4 months now and still loves it. It fit on our crib without a problem, but it took a little rigging to get it on the pack n play.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Grabner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for developing eyes
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves looking at this mobile! It’s easy to put together, and I appreciate that each card has a listed age on it so you know when to swap out the cards. We were able to attach this to our baby’s isolette in the NICU and his Halo swivel bassinet.
customer_reviews.author: BCMA

customer_reviews.title: So glad we purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by a friend, and we purchased it for our newborn when she was ~7 weeks old. We have it over her changing table. She's 3.5 months old now and it's been so incredibly fun to see how mesmerized she has been by the different discs. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: ajm

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The toy is very well designed and our baby loves it! However plastic ridges that help fix the length of the string are flimsy. At times the string will extend by itself if it was at fixed length and thus resulting in falling images effect on the baby. Our baby always gets scared of it. Processing a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Orkhan

customer_reviews.title: Baby is Entranced
customer_reviews.text: Our two-month-old baby is completely engrossed by this mobile! Simple, somewhat delicate, and priced accordingly. Not motorized, but light enough to twist in even the slightest breeze. I don't know if everybody's baby will love it like ours, but it's so cheap that it's certainly worth a try. Easily clamped onto our Foundations Serenity crib.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S. Kuris

customer_reviews.title: Great for development
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up. Great for newborn and up. They can see the high contrast Images as a newborn and the images face them. My daughter is 7 months and still loves looking at the images which u can move around
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Disliked assembly, I thought I was going to break it popping the two pieces together. But I loved this. My baby loved this above his changing table. And I loved that you could interchange the pieces and introduce new things and keep it interesting. Although he really liked the baby one for a long time, so much that I got the travel mobile as well!
customer_reviews.author: IMC

customer_reviews.title: Fell on my son
customer_reviews.text: This a very fragile and and flimsy product. I grazed it while putting my son in the crib and the string came undone whole thing fell on him. Thankfully it made of flimsy cheap plastic so he was wasn't hurt, just startled. I gave two stars because if its not falling on his head he likes to look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Esposito III

customer_reviews.title: I like that there are different sides to flip over as ...
customer_reviews.text: My infant daughter is obsessed with the images on this mobile. I like that there are different sides to flip over as she grows developmentally. I only put the discs flat on the bottom of the mobile and taped the extras above my changing table for her to enjoy during diaper changes. Works like a charm and keeps her entertained!
customer_reviews.author: Jess S.

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable for baby
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this for our 7 week old son and he absolutely loves it. He makes an incredible amount of happy noises while watching it. It doesn't rotate or play music so we bought a universal box that does and hooked it up to it. Would give five stars if it was the complete package (rotated and played music).
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: I dunno
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t super impressed when it came untied and fell over my child. Luckily it missed her but it fell like a cage around her head.
customer_reviews.author: The Antic

customer_reviews.title: Buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: Collapsible so why would I place this above my newborn?
customer_reviews.author: Julissa V.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It's made for babys no for the adults that want a beautiful room. It's perfect for the eye development that babys have
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Nice design but engineering is poor
customer_reviews.text: Nice design but engineering is poor. Those cards fell off on my baby a few times when the mobile is touched by accident. There is no mechanism to keep the cards locked in the hooks. And since the cards are just hooked they easily fall off. I wouldn't recommend this product. You can buy other products with contrast images that are safer for your little one.
customer_reviews.author: Oksana

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart quite easily
customer_reviews.text: While this was easy enough to put together, it was quite fragile and would fall apart at the slightest bump. I only had it in my son’s crib for about a week before modifying it for his pack and play so I could monitor it with him. That being said, he really enjoyed it when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Haley M.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother.
customer_reviews.text: Within 5 minutes after assembly the knot (which came pre-tied) came untied and fell on my 2 month olds face. Also, the slot in the arm base for the crib was just too small to fit, I had to wedge it on and scratched my crib. Extremely disappointed. Im was so excited for what turned out to be such a let down. I’m sure this may work for others. But I returned it the day I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Idea is good but product is so-so.
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea but poor execution. The circular mobiles easily fall, so make sure it is not placed right above the baby's head. The manufacture is crude with visible rough edges. Looks nice from a distance and when not under careful perusal. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Effective
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my little one! She loved to look at the different shapes and the best part is you can change the 'disks' out based on her eye development. Simple and effective!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So useful
customer_reviews.text: Baby doesn't spend time in her crib yet so I used the cards to make a little book and taped some to the bouncy chair. More for her eyes to check out until they develop more. I also printed out similar patterns and put them on the ceiling for her to look at while I'm our bedroom. I'm do glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Mesmerizing.
customer_reviews.text: The kids really love it. I wish it was a bit bigger-we used it over the changing table and they are mesmerized.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Mrs. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mobile and how you can switch out the cards depending on their age. I only wish you could detach the spinning part from the base so there were more hanging options! My 5mo old son still enjoys looking at it occasionally while in his crib
customer_reviews.author: CpSb

product_meta.title: Manhattan Toy Wimmer-Ferguson Infant Stim-Mobile for Cribs
product_meta.description: The Wimmer-Ferguson Infant Stim-Mobile for Cribs Introduces baby to high contrast images and colors for early visual and multisensory development. Ten interchangeable graphic cards offer a range of simple high-contrast images to more complex colored patterns and graphics to foster visual development. Graphic cards are labeled by age to guide you with recommended graphics to use as baby's vision develops. Adjustable cord on the Infant Stim-Mobile allows you to easily change distance of graphics from baby as their vision develops. Baby toy suitable for newborns up to 5 months old; Wimmer-Ferguson toy graphics and designs are based on scientific research of visual development in early infancy.
feature_bullets: BLACK AND WHITE DEVELOPMENTAL TOYS: From Manhattan Toy’s award winning Wimmer-Ferguson infant collection - the original innovator of black and white developmental toys. The patterns of all Wimmer-Ferguson products adapt to baby's changes in visual development by featuring a range of design complexity and color, inspired by laboratory research.

INFANT STIM-MOBILE FOR CRIBS DETAILS: Introduces baby to high contrast images and colors for early visual development with a hanging mobile over little one's crib. Ten interchangeable cards offer a range of simple to more complex colored patterns and graphics.

ADAPTABLE FOR BABY'S GROWTH: Adjustable cord on the Stim-Mobile allows you to easily change distance of cards from baby as they grow and their vision develops (keep out of reach, however). Graphic cards are labeled by age to guide you with recommended graphics as baby grows.

VISUALLY APPEALING HIGH CONTRAST TOY FOR INFANTS: Professional research has shown that newborns are more attracted to high-contrast patterns than to color or brightness alone. The Wimmer-Ferguson Infant Stim-Mobile for Cribs was designed for this purpose, encouraging baby to learn pattern recognition from the start.

WIMMER-FERGUSON COLLECTION BY MANHATTAN TOY: The developmental toys for babies and infants in the Wimmer-Ferguson collection encourage eye-hand coordination, gross motor activity, self-awareness, sense of object permanence and experience with cause and effect.
